text:
Sri Lanka aims to make tourism top foreign exchange earner Published on : Tuesday, September 8, 2015
Aiming to make tourism as the top foreign exchange earner, Sri Lanka is eyeing more Chinese tourists to the island nation, a cabinet minister said in Colombo on Monday.
Sri Lanka’s new Tourism Minister, John Amaratunga, was sworn in on Friday and will officially begin his duties on Monday.
“Many Chinese tourists come to Sri Lanka. But we want to increase the tourists number. We have to provide the opportunity for Chinese who are willing to visit Sri Lanka,” Amaratunga said.
More than 24,000 Chinese tourists arrived in Sri Lanka in August, according to statistics by the Sri Lanka Tourism Promotion Bureau.
China has become the largest source of tourists to Sri Lanka.
Amaratunga hopes ‘to improve the tourism industry and make it the country’s top foreign exchange earner.’
